description:
Let's get one thing straight, The Final Final is the best bar in San Francisco.  Why you may ask?  Lots of reasons, here are some of my top reasons:

They have the best Irish Coffee in San Francisco.  Don't even get me started on this one.  
They pour strong cocktails
They are the friendliest, unless your a jerk, you probably deserve it.
They have every meaningful sport playing on TV.
The food comes out quick.  
You might run into a celebrity.

Reasons to avoid Final Final:
You hate fun.
You prefer to piss away your money at lower class establishments.
You like to be a prick to bartenders.
Photobooths scare you.
Too many sports TVs make you anxious.
author: B C.

description:
I'm taking the star count from one to two stars based on how cool the woman owner is. Great manager & person and very hospitable. 

With that said, I have to deduct 3 stars based on my interactions with the older male bartender last night. He was incredibly rude, short, and really should try and find a job in accounting or somewhere behind a desk. Further to Emylis point below....it wasn't just because he wouldn't give the blantons topper to us either. It was just his vibe that was a huge downer. If you're gonna reject someone's request for a blantons topper...Be a bartender and reject us WITH SOME CHARISMA!!! 

My group spent about $700-1000 at the bar within a 3 hour period (12 person softball team plus girlfriends) celebrating a golf outing to cap the year off. 

If you would have given out the blantons topper, we would have considered making your bar our 2019 after-game softball hangout, dishing you tons of cash. But not anymore. It's the small details in life that matter.
author: Tom R.

description: Nice little divey-feeling sports bar! Lots of TVs and a great selection of beers and ciders. They do serve some basic bar food (pizza, fries). They host Monday night trivia at 8 with prizes (% off your bar tabs). Friendly bartenders, clean, one of my new favorite spots!
author: Jeanette R.

description: Came for a drink and appetizers had a good time. Friendly atmosphere. Sports casual attire. Went in with a party of 6 and loved the beer selection there was the right one for all of our different taste buds.
author: Lucy G.

description: Terrible service but I suppose that's to be expected at a dive bar. Usually we go to nicer places but tonight we were celebrating a softball event and the team wanted to celebrate close to home. When we saw the nearly empty bottle of Blanton's we were excited to buy a few drinks to score another one of the collectible toppers but after buying two rounds, the bartender rudely said "no, we don't give those to customers, our owner collects them!" Classy.  We'll make sure to spend our money elsewhere next time. Let the owner know that his collectibles are losing him customers. He might take a hospitality note from Bobo's Burgers. Good pizza though.
author: Emyli V.

description: Beer and service are fine, but the food is trash. Don't come here looking for food. The menu is really small and even the few options they have aren't good
author: Richard C.

description:
Local neighborhood bar, pretty steady on a Friday night when we were there. Nice bartenders and very attentive although the drinks seem more expensive than most places unfortunately.... 

Nice place to watch a big game I'm sure (haven't tried it out for that yet), but if I'm just looking to get a drink, I'll probably go somewhere else or the next block to my house!
author: Bethany M.

description:
This bar is the shit!!!! BEST CHARGING STATION IN TOWN (cords provided, don't be a dick and try to take one either they're super glued) Aside from the charging station, my boyfriend and I are from San Diego (my first time in this beautiful city) and we were with his sister and her man who live here in SF..we were initially here to just plug in our phones + grab a quick drink and get back on the electric scooters so we can dip around town, but ended up staying much longer..which was most definitely worth it! 

The whole environment / vibe of the bar was super chill, fun and entertaining! Pool table and darts, ya really can't go wrong! On top of the dope ass activities with great company, bartenders were excellent (their playlist for music--and I like my music loud..was random but real good random) and just overall I felt like it was a family owned business where you really felt the love. I didn't catch any names but thank you all for all your hospitality and for an awesome time!!! 

Bad reviews should be irrelevant, experience things and places for yourself but if you have something to complain or be mad about..writing a bad review is such a waste of good space for better ones. DEFINITELY come grab a drink here if you're in the area & shoot some darts! ;)

OH! And FREE POPCORN, yaaaaasss! That adios (AMF as they say here) was just as good as ones back home, that gummy bear was deliciously sweet and they had great white!!!! Which made me think of home and sippin bottles of that on the beach!
author: Lyn B.

description:
Finally, I've got some time to review the final, ultimate sports bar in the Marina/Cow Hollow district, a sleepy neighborhood dive called the Final Final. 

There isn't anything super remarkable about the place, but that's what makes it special. It's a sports bar complete with many TVs for viewing (what else?) sports, a long horseshoe bar, a couple pool tables and plenty of memorabilia on the walls. They aren't reinventing the wheel here. But you will feel at home in no time grabbing a seat next to some locals and catching a game or two. I know I did. 

They have a great beer selection and the friendly bartenders pour 'em stiff. It only took two gin and tonics for me to feel the midday buzz, and that was after I ate a huge slice of pizza. 

As far as sports bars go, The Final Final can rub shoulders with the best of them. But don't take my advice. See for yourself and have the final word.
author: Alex L.

description:
Such a great spot - for both locals and out-of-towners.  It's the quintessential SF gathering place with classic SF architectural charm, prohibition-era figurines, pool tables, dart boards, popcorn machine, jukebox, large screen TVs and a warm and inviting staff.  

The bar is family owned and operated and comes with a great backstory that will make you beam.  When you visit, be sure to ask the owners bartending son, Elliot, for the Final Final's beginning.  It's a story you won't forget!
author: Nikki H.

description:
Bar, where you can drink during eating buffalo hot wings. I like crunchy wing and there hasn't been. That's why I enjoyed hot dog, it was delicious with nacho cheese. Also we ordered tortilla chips with cheese sauce. When you put all this stuff together, it is a feast. We drink it down with the beer.
Definitely great night in San Francisco.
author: Martin K.

description: Service is great, very chill atmosphere. Good pricing on drinks. I had their wings, definitely tasted as if they microwaved some frozen wings. If you're really hungry, I suggest just getting some fries or the soft pretzel.
author: Darby D.

description: Meh. I really don't see the point but if you are young, want a reasonable beer and don't care about ambiance then by all means go.
author: Dani B.

description:
The Final Final is a total dive bar, but I really loved the atmosphere and the vibes going on. If you are looking for a good place to grab a beer with friends, watch the game, or play a game of pool, this is the bar for you. They even have their own Snapchat filter!! 

They have all the normal beers on draft, and have a wide selection of bar food, nothing too gourmet at all. But they also have a free popcorn machine. This is a fun place to check out!
author: Ross S.

description:
I've seldom entered an old-school bar replete with lots of wood including wonderful bar that did not satisfy and The Final Final kept my old-school bar record going.

I decided to sup on their wings that were meaty, moist and very tasty. All of course were washed down with Bushmills shots backed with a Lager the name to which I cannot recall.

Staff were attentive. Wings were tasty. Bushmills and beer were served without delay. What else might you ask of an old-school bar?
author: Jay D.

description: Nice sport bar, decent selection of drinks. Food is mediocre, do not and I mean it do not get the hot wings. It tasted like frozen foster farms wings. Just horrible. Other than that great place for Hangouts.
author: Dracula A.

description: I'm so glad we have a local spot, family owned, that truly cares about the experience of its' patrons. Excellent service and quality selection of beers. During a local game, this is the kind of place that you have to show up early for, but every second you're there is worth it.
author: Troy N.

description:
If you're a fan of great sports bars that have history screaming from the walls, The Final Final is your stop. Situated in an area of Cow Hollow/Marina that's not as easily accessible to the BROS, it always has a good crowd. I suppose it helps that I live two blocks from this bar too...it's my local watering hole. 

I'm a huge fan of places with free popcorn and the machine in the back of the bar is always full :) They have two pool tables, a few dart boards and tons of TV's. Note: the pool tables are usually shut down during big game days and the evenings for sake of space. 

I think more that anything it's important to have a local sports bar that is casual and easy. A place where you can wear your favorite jersey, head to after your co-ed softball league, etc.

Family owned & operated. Ben approved.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Horrible service! Who turns patrons away claiming they're full when there's clearly standing room. A lady just wanted to watch the Warriors game!
author: B W.

description:
Chill dive bar that's good for bigger groups.

Popcorn, pool tables, darts, and good drinks.
author: Shelley K.

description: This is far and away my favorite bar in San Francisco. The staff work diligently to create a fun and inclusive atmosphere where everyone can feel comfortable, safe, and have a good time. With 24 beers on tap and an amazing group of bartenders you will never leave here disappointed. If I could give them more than 5 stars I would.
author: Joshua L.

description:
We checked out this spot on a stormy Thursday night in December, and it was still pretty packed. Final Final is a fun, laid-back bar with a divey vibe, but keeps it classy. They had a pool table and plenty of stools/seating, and pulled a decent number of draft beers. The party I was with stuck to pitchers of 805, and I killed off the last couple of $2 Jello Shots they had available behind the bar. 

This was a great place to bring a group (we were about 10, and were among several other groups of 5+; everyone had plenty of elbow room), and while it's definitely a bar, it wasn't so loud that we had to scream at one another. The clientele is a decent number of twenty-something sports fans jocking around and watching games on the TVs. Pretty harmless all around. 

If you're in the area and are looking for a chill spot to grab a couple beers and chat with friends, this is a solid spot!
author: Laura B.

description:
I went there because I was in SF on a football Sunday and this place yelped as a Vikings bar. There were some Vikings fans there but a lot of other people, and all the various games were on the TVs scattered around the place. So if you're looking for a place where you can watch any game this would work. As a real go-to spot for Vikings fans though it's not all that. 
But the three stars are mainly about the food. Not good. The wings were gooey, like maybe they had been boiled, not even drained or dried very well, and then just dredged in some sauce. The pizza was a little better but only by comparison to the scary wings.
Still, it's a bar with nice people and lots of TVs. An ok place, depending on what you're looking for.
author: Dale H.

description: In search for a Bloody Mary for the new year and stumbled across this place since I did not want to be surrounded by obnoxious 20-somethings. The Bloody Mary was decent, bartender was super nice, and there was only a few obnoxious 20-somethings= score!
author: Vanessa O.

description: Literally the best.  We have watched everything here.  When the Warriors won the finals, World Series, Olympics, it's the best ambiance and we'll trek over from Mid-Market to watch any important game.  They do such a good job of not overcrowding this bar so it's always comfortable, even on craziest nights, but because of that make sure you get here early before big games.  Free popcorn and Papa John's pizza is a fun touch.  Reasonable prices.  This is our favorite sports bar in the city.  So much so that when we got married in the Presidio nearby, we opened a bar tab for all our guests after the reception and dumped 100 crazy wedding guests on the bar on a random night...two of our guests met, hit it off at the bar, and got married a year later.  So, what's the moral of the story?  Watch good sports, eat free popcorn, and find your soul mate.  What's not to love?
author: James S.

description:
Asshole central, don't come. 

The bartender got into an argument with my friend about basketball. He essentially said well if you have that opinion then you clearly don't know what you're talking about. A rude thing to say.. 

So she said dude you're an asshole. And suddenly he was super offended that he was called an asshole. He grabbed her beer, dumped it and said don't call your bartender an asshole. 

Wow everyone was so rude and defended him. I'd rather give business to decent human beings, thanks.
author: Monica B.

description: Cool bar. A lot of locals and not very touristy which is nice. There are pool tables in the back and a good amount of space to hang and drink some beers
author: Jenna G.

description: Excellent place for sports and drinks! They have many TVs and then pool tables, darts, etc. They also offer free popcorn which is great while watching sports games!
author: Curtis C.

description:
This is a nice bar on the edge of the presidio. 
It's a fairly standard style American sports bar, but the prices are good and the bar staff are very friendly. 
They have a popcorn machine at the back of the bar where you can help yourself. It is also a good place to watch American football- Not too busy and a nice crowd. 
They also have good pizza; great for sharing during the football games.
author: Derek M.

description: This is by far one of my favorite bars. Their beer options on draft are endless and they have a huge selection of hard alcohol too. Perfect place to watch a game (Go Dubs!). Thanks for the great service!
author: Juliet O.

description:
Solid neighborhood sports bar. Even though it's not located on Chestnut Street, it's still very much a Marina bar. You'll find plenty of "bros" still trying to hold on to their college days, as well as attractive 20-something girls (who are pretending to like sports to impress the dudes).

Final Final ain't fancy. Nor is it trying to be. They serve reasonably priced beer and hard liquor, and they have plenty of TV screens for watching what ever game happens to be playing. They also have pool tables in the back, and plenty of room and tables for boozin' and schmoozin'. There's no pretense here. What you see is what you get.

This bar is a great way to start your evening (before heading elsewhere) or finish your night (once the house party keg has been tapped). 

Be warned, if you're over 35, you might be the oldest person in the room. But all in all, this is a cool spot and a Marina institution.
author: Kevin B.

description: We had our wedding after party here and it was great! We had a number of SF locals at our wedding and everyone was looking forward to coming here after. Ordered a bunch of pizzas in advance and it was much appreciated by our drunk hungry wedding guests. Everyone had a great night! Thanks Final Final!
author: Alex O.

description:
Worst wings I have ever had.  The outside was charred, and I could taste the cold on the inside  - leftover from being frozen.  They were basically flash-heated in the oven.  Terrible.  I'm not expecting gourmet at a bar, but I do expect food to be better than terrible.  

Aside from food, atmosphere is cool.  Good place to watch sports.
author: Casey R.

description:
This is an awesome sports bar. My kickball team comes here after every Wednesday evening games. The bartender is super cool and friendly, always greets us with big hello's! 

The booze is not expensive and they have some good beers on tap. There are also two pool tables, several TVs, and a jukebox to keep you entertained. 

Definitely check it out!
author: Emmy Q.

description: This is a wonderful family run neighborhood hangout.  We especially like weekdays afternoons to just hang and have a beer.
author: Eva M.

description:
Great staff, very friendly... 

Probably best bar in SF.  What's not to love about final final? 

Been coming in for years to watch college football (Nebraska Huskers) on Saturdays and those other days you just feel like a drink/beer.
author: K H.

description:
How can anyone gives this place less than 5 stars?!  The Final Final is a great sports bar.  I've been coming here for years to watch the warriors and the giants and USC (don't judge) and whoever else is on for a "big game." They always have a decent beer menu (IPAs for my husband, something less intense for me) and they have free unlimited popcorn. FREE UNLIMITED POPCORN.  They also have pizzas and wings that you can order, if you so choose.  The waitresses and bar tenders are great... they are a no nonsense crew and I appreciate that when sports bars in the marina can get a little out of hand (so many egos in one room...)

I totally recommend this place, just get there early if you want a good seat for a popular game!
author: Brooke S.

description: One of those friendly neighborhood bars that manages to make strangers feel welcome. Nothing pretentious. Just beer, darts, pool, the usual cocktails. Clean, friendly and an above average tap list. All ads up for when of the best bars in the area.
author: Scott E.

description: Good family-run neighborhood bar. They have SUPER friendly staff, 2 pool tables, cheap drinks, and decent bar food. Don't expect anything fancy as this is a very casual bar but it is a great place to watch a game or meet up with friends.
author: B D.

description: We had an employee event at Final Final last night and they couldn't have been nicer. The highlight of the night was a lovely server named Sydney. I bartended for seven years and I have strong opinions on service. Sydney couldn't have been nicer. I would return just to be served by her.
author: David G.

description: This place is one of my favorite bars! It's a place I can see taking my dad to and have a good time! The Bartenders are legit and friendly. They support a lot of different teams but no matter there isn't any judgement! They have a lot of beers on tab but it's not the best price but great environment! Great place to pre-game that's for sure!
author: Anthony C.

description:
Free popcorn. 
$11 pizzas. 
Bourbon/peach/pineapple drinks. 
Great service from the bartender Tim. 
Juke box with songs that take ya way back.
6 cocktails and a pizza for $38 +tip?!?!
Amazing
author: Christine E.

description: i came to TFF for the first time with my best friend Bob.  At first I was skeptical because I thought I was going to a pretentious place due to the location.  I was wrong,it made an impression on the staff and I was made feel at home, each time I went,  Family owned and has a great selection of beers and bar food menu too.  I had the BBQ Pork Shanks and were delicious,  My friend that lives in the Presidio is moving back to Sacramento, but will stop by and say hello next time I'm in the area
author: Hum V.

description: It does the job you want it to! Get drunk on the cheap! They've got a pretty decent selection of beer on tap (so glad they have one of my favorites, Allagash White) and solid liquor available. Grab some popcorn from the back and pull up a chair with the homies and start throwing them back! Lots of locals and people who work in the area frequent this spot, but there's plenty of room inside. There's a pool table and TVs all around so you can watch whatever you need to, as long as it's the Warriors, Giants, or Niners!
author: Aaron Y.

description: Maybe it was my bad -- don't order a Bloody Mary here. It's loaded with MSG and came with only a lime: no olives, celery, lemon, horseradish, etc. The bartender was aloof and there was a group in the bar that was hammered (that's ok!) and extremely obnoxious/rude at 12pm on a Sunday.
author: Kira M.

description:
Not full of frat boys looking to fight you, so its got that going for it.

If it wasn't stationed in the Marina, it would probably grow a bit more divey, which, would be an improvement. 

As it is, popcorn machine, standard fare of alcohol, barely tolerable level of douchinista, it's a meh. It's a C. As Yelp so eloquently puts it, this place is "A-OK".
author: Darrell L.

description: Been going here for a long time. Nothing that is super special about the place. Free popcorn, pool, darts and a small menu of various drunchies. They have a ton of screens to watch your favorite games on. It's pretty much what a sports bar should be. Good place to grab a beer with friends after work and unwind while the game is on.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Darts, pool, cheap beer, pizza and TVs. 

There isn't much more that you need to make a great bar! 

The Final Final always ends up being involved on our night out rotation and never disappoints!

The bar does full up rather quickly when there is a major sporting event but not so bad that you won't be able to stand comfortably.
author: Kristin F.

description:
I've never ever left a bad review for any bar... But this one, so unbelievable. Totally harassed at the door by two super young guys that wouldn't let me in BC of fire code capacity.. Which is fine and I was cool with that, but, when someone left and I was told by the door guy to walk in.... They then chased me to get my ID which I had already shown to the other guy who was super unaware BC he was playing grab ass with his GF at the bar while working. Then while the one guy was asking for my ID "grab ass" boy came up to me aggressively saying I couldn't come in still.. Obviously these two were not communicating. Anyway... Then BC I was upset about them bombarding me BC they weren't communicating, "grab ass" boy said to me "We don't even have to let you in" with which I replied "you guys are being really mean".. I showed my ID and walked away......., I will probably NEVER go here again! So awkward and uncomfortable as a 33 year old woman just trying to meet up with some friends....completely harassed about my ID and then threatened to kick me out!!! No Bueno! 
Whoever the door guys were 9/24/16... 
Sad, BC it looks like a fun bar :(
author: Liza F.

description: Marina Sports Bar with food (nothing great) but OK. Lots of beer choices. Pool tables. Pretty girls. Good bartenders and a good vibe. Recommend for Sunday football.
author: Allan B.

description:
This is a great sports bar. The staff is kind and they have a variety of beers on tap. The prices are also reasonable (especially for SF!). 

They also have free popcorn, which they make fresh each day. Who doesn't love that?!
author: Hayley N.

description:
I went here after having my birthday party at House of Air. We ordered the Papa John's pizza and it was piping hot. Someone else ordered chicken wings and thoroughly enjoyed them. They have 2 pool tables. I like the layout of the U-shaped bar and there seems to be plenty of space. And yes, the free popcorn was a nice touch.

The door in the back says Pool and Spa, employees only. I don't know if this was a joke or if there really is a spa back there. I was intrigued. LOL.
author: Marty J.

description: Great bar to unwind after sightseeing the Golden Gate bridge
author: Lauren B.

description: If you don't like this place, get out. Matrix or Tipsy Pig will gladly accept you, you can join their scene down the street. This is a neighborhood favorite, that carries a lot of memories for all.  The bartenders treat you like a regular, even if you only go in once in a while.  There is plenty of space, multiple activities, and plenty of sports broadcast, all topped off with timely service.
author: Allison B.

description: Awesome bartenders, dollar tree ass ranch dressing. Mike was my bartender. He was superb until he brought me my wings lol. Mike didn't know I was a ranch snob, but he learned that today. He tried to pass off this sham of a dressing as Hidden Valley. When it was really some dollar tree ish. I'd rather he punch me in the nose, then to be served dollar tree ranch! My people have come too far to be served dollar tree ranch! As much money as I spend there, they can invest in better ranch. Let's not talk about the ketchup. If it ain't Heinz it ain't right. Get it together Final Final lol! No seriously, get better ranch or I will rain down on your business like a Georgia thunderstorm.
author: Jared O.

description:
Stopped in here on a Wednesday night around 6pm, and there was probably 10-15 patrons here.  They had multiple TVs, a great bar area with 6-8 small tables, a large 3 sided bar to sit around, and 2 pool tables in the back.  

Enjoyed the free popcorn machine.  Beers were slightly more expensive than other local neighborhood bars ($6) for a draught beer, especially given that it was dead, and 6pm.   I'll be back regardless..
author: Logan C.

description:
Liked this place a lot until yesterday.  They have free popcorn, a wide selection of beers on tap, and lots of TVs to catch your favorite game.

They also have a really rude staffer.

We were there for the 49ers playoff game, and 5 minutes after the end of the game, he came by to collect our pitchers.  The problem is, there was still beer in them.  Now, if he'd said anything at all, like "hey, I need to get these in the dishwasher, can I pour your beer in a glass for you?" this would be a 4 or 5 star review.  Instead, he said nothing and tried to take our beer.  When we told him we weren't done with the pitchers, he said "Yes you are," and kept trying to take them.  Finally, he slammed them down and yelled "then you'd better pour them into a glass right now, because I'm taking these pitchers!"

Look, if you need to clean up after the game, that's great.  But why treat your customers with a total lack of respect?  It makes no sense.
author: Jeff M.

description: Good, solid, neighborhood bar.  This is, as the name would imply, a great place to end the night.  I have many fond memories of playing darts here at 1am wearing a gown from an earlier event that evening.
author: Greta R.

description:
Free popcorn!!!

This is really what gets me the most because whenever I'm drinking I ALWAYS want a salty snack, and popcorn is one of the best. The beers are average priced for this city, I think every one I've gotten was either $6 or $6.5. The staff is super friendly and attentive!
author: Christine U.

description:
"I love this bar
It's my kind of place
Just walkin' through the front door puts a big smile on my face
It ain't too far
Come as you are
Mmmm, I love this bar"
-Toby Keith

Yup, Toby pretty much summed up how I feel about The Final Final. It's a 35-45 minute drive from my house and it's worth the drive every time. Relatively easy to find street parking, good drinks, free popcorn, decent bar food, pool tables, dart boards, TVs everywhere, clean restrooms, and a juke box. Oh, and can't forget about the awesome people behind the bar, who are actually the reason for the five star rating.

Although it is a sports bar, I've never actually come here to watch a game so I can't say much for how crowded or wild it gets on "game day". It does get pretty packed on the weekends after 10pm though so don't be surprised if there's a line of people waiting out the door.
author: Glenda G.

description:
Cold beer, super friendly staff, and fun amenities ( quality pool tables, darts, popcorn machine). The crowd is normally quite friendly and its easy to share some laughs. 

Overall great neighborhood bar with a name you can't forget!
author: Felipe C.

description:
Final Final is right by my office and while it definitely is not in the same grouping as all the boutique bars around SF,  I have kind of a soft spot for dive-y bars.  The drinks aren't terrible,  they rarely get crowded, and the bar itself is not at all pretentious like all the speakeasy-type bars around.

The service is nothing to write home about but I definitely did not have a bad experience and in my book that's already ahead of the curve.

I'll likely be back at least a good many times more.
author: Chris C.

description:
After Brunch we decided to walk around town and then wanted to watch Football and have a couple drinks. We found this place on yelp and boy was it a great place.  Well at first the Bartender was nice but not super friendly but as we sat there he became super friendly and we had a great time.. HE finally was engaging and made this first here awesome. will be back soon. great place.. 

Try the Loopy Vodka.... Ask Mike he will make you some good drinks.
author: Matthew F.

description: The Final Final is a great, family run establishment and I enjoy going there as much as I can. The patrons are great and always good for some laughs. Great place to watch the Giants, Warriors and Sharks!  Free popcorn is cool but cold beer is even better. I like The Final Final because it is slightly off the beaten path in a quiet neighborhood but it isn't too far from the action on Chestnut Street in the Marina. If you're looking for a good time with good people, check it out!
author: Wayne S.

description: Great bar! Family owned and ran. Great people and good atmosphere. Plenty of TVs for game day. Always free popcorn and lots of beers on tap. Always a good time!
author: Rory F.

description:
I can't help but like this bar...

They have darts. My favorite bar game. 

It's a Vikings bar. If I don't feel like going to Belltower (the only other Vikings hangout that I know of) this is a good option. 

Drinks are strong. Pretty sure I had a gin on the rocks instead of a gin & tonic.

Free popcorn.
author: Sara P.

description: This place has hands-down my favorite plug socket in the entire city. Men's bathroom, right above the stall. Perfect for charging your phone whilst inexplicably several feet up in the air. I'm only giving it five stars because Yelp won't let me give it six. Highly recommended.
author: Joseph B.

description:
The wife and I come up to watch the Iowa Hawkeyes football games here, and are NEVER disappointed. Yes, I have a wife who

a) drinks beer
b) watches football

What I did to deserve this sublime specimen of female awesomeness is beyond me, but the Final Final is a perfect place to take in a game. Free popcorn served up in those fantastic plastic school lunch bowls. If you look into them, you may see a ghost of the Chili Con Carne that lived there back 1987. Also, Papa John's pizza for order, cheese for $11. 

Beer selection is fantastic, with lots of local goodies (North Coast, Truman, Bear Republic and more). Currently they have the Racer X, which is the double IPA from Bear Republic and worth every penny. Good seating at the bar and plenty of TVs.
author: Barney T.

description: Large dive bar with relatively inexpensive beers, somewhat friendly service, pool tables, darts, and popcorn maker in the back with unlimited free popcorn! Definitely a place to have a low-key gathering with plenty of space -- probably my idea of the perfect dive bar (if there is such a thing to people!).
author: Siv L.

description: Came here to watch one of the Warriors games. Was helped at the bar with haste, which was appreciated considering the busy times. But the bartender with the faux-hawk and dark rimmed glasses was very disagreeable with me. He snakily criticized me for wanting to close out my tab right away and then had some computer troubles when printing my bill which caused me to wait a while. When I was about to inquire with another bartender what was going on and then realized that there was probably a computer/printing issue I told him with a smile, "never mind." Faux-hawk came up and snapped at me (again) for "complaining" to another bartender when I never even had a change to ask my question. He was assumptive and extremely rude to me for absolutely no reason. I was beside myself. Working in the food and beverage industry for many years I would have NEVER EVER treated a customer this way. Furthermore, the manager didn't do enough to smooth this over. He listened to the story and did not even offer to take care of the two beers. After the game he then thanked us for staying to watch and said that he wasn't going to talk to he employee right away because the Warriors had won and he didn't want to 'kill' the mood. Why would you say this to an upset customer?? Had it not been for this particular bartender, I would have had a fine time watching the game and would have ordered from the mother who was friendly and working hard and fast to make sure that everyone had what they needed.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: Love finding Husker bars across America a.  Even better when owned and operated by a true Husker!  Felt at home.
author: David P.

description: This is a great place to watch the sharks games. The bartender is wearing a jersey and walking around checking in with people. They have free popcorn, variety of beers and a small menu to order food of as well. It's an awesome local place, will always bring my friends here.
author: Amy J.

description: Came here for Sunday Funday - this is coming from the queen of dive bars - this place rocks!!!!! I love the ambiance and the fact that the beer is cold and the service is quick - will be back !!!!
author: Abby G.

description: After much debate with my friends, we ended up here on a Friday night after hitting up a few places in the Marina. The exterior of the place is non-descript but fits the vibe of the place.  The inside of the joint makes you feel right at home. I was particularly impressed by the waitress and her depth of knowledge on the drinks menu.  The best part is they have all you can eat popcorn and it is delicious popcorn, similar to the kind you get at movie theaters.
author: Justin E.

description:
Awesome corner dive bar in the edge of the Marina.  Great place to catch up with your laid back friends, watch some sports, play some pool, snack on free popcorn and throw back some nice cold beers!

They also sell pizza here which I never tried.  I usually come here to just have a "Ying and the boys" night out.
author: Ying F.

description:
I was downing pints of Stella over at Flybar on Divis, and the next thing I knew I was getting into a cab with my group. 

Me: "Where are we going?" 
Ashley: "The Marina." 
Me: *hangs head and wants to puke* (and NOT from drinking!) 

I didn't actually hear exactly where we were going.  All I could think about was the fact I was going to the Marina wearing the same clothes I had been wearing all day, since going out at all that night was a last minute decision and I wasn't planning on the Marina! Anyways, we pull up to this place and I'm thinking "Where the hell are we!?!" I was later informed by a guy that apparently comes here regularly that we were actually in SOLO...south of Lombard (gotta love how much some people will break down SF). 

We walk into the place and the first thing I said to one of my friends is "We're not in the City anymore." Not that I don't ADORE this city, but it definitely needs a place like this. 

1) They serve alcohol (always a plus for a bar) 
2) It's a REAL sports bar (and a regionally affiliated sports bar at that. There were a few Nebraska banners hanging up and they were playing the Big10 network on the TV, so I guess there's some sort of Midwest connection).  I'm from AZ where regionally affiliated sports bars are all over the place, so this felt like home.   
3) It's unpretentious 
4) It's a dive, but not TOO divey (trust me, there's places in the City a lot divier than this place) 
5) They have a juke box 
6) They have a pool table 
7) They have FREE popcorn 

In addition to this they serve bar food. I didn't try and it didn't look good, but I didn't care since I wasn't eating it. Our waitress for the evening was a doll. It sounds like from some of the more negative reviews I've read on this place poor service was an issue, and I can't say I experienced that at all. Our waitress was prompt with drinks, had no problem managing several tabs, and most important had no problem dealing with obnoxious drunk people (*me raising hand*). I also talked to the big bad owner/manager a few reviewers have mentioned and I found him to be quite pleasant. I'll DEFINITELY be back.
author: George A.

description:
I end up at Final Final roughly twice a year when I'm in the area on business, and I always gravitate towards it after I'm done with the serious stuff - it's a great spot to relax and regroup. I was first drawn to it because the name fascinated me - there was a certain, hm, finality, to it that spoke to my then-sense of accomplishment, and boy did it deliver. Now, I've never been there to watch a game or even to have more than one drink, for that matter, but it seems to be a place where they don't mind if you're not there to watch a game - I have always loved the service and the atmosphere (and though it looks like there is almost no food on the menu, everything I tried was very good, plus there's free popcorn (not my thing, but it's great that they have it!) 

All of the bartenders are super-nice and very accommodating. I always seem to end in sports bars, even though I'm not into sports at all - and I feel really good in this one. There's a lot of interesting decor going on (I learn a lot about sports by just looking at the walls), plus the TVs are strategically positioned around the space - you basically can't look anywhere without seeing a screen.Plus (Europeans rejoice), a couple of times they actually showed sports that nobody really cares about, like soccer and F1 (though not an actual race) on just one screen - but I happen to know a lot of people who would appreciate this one screen :)

It seems to be a great local spot, and the groups drinking at the bar are always very cheerful and nice. I can't speak to what it looks like in the evenings, but if you're in the area midday and feel like having a drink - in my experience, they'll be happy to take care of you, and you'll leave feeling, well, at peace.
author: D K.

description:
Came here last night with some peeps from my softball team. It was fairly crowded due to the fact that it was a stop of the Alpha Bar group (where every other week a group goes to a bar starting with a different letter). 

We ordered draft bud lights for $3 and a friend ordered a pizza for $11.25. They have a lot of great muchie foods, snacks and lots of draft beers! I think the normal price is around 5-6$. 

The bouncer was nice, the bartenders were super slammed and very nice! Great service, great products of course, so I'm a fan! I'll be back when I'm over in that area. 

My recommendation: Go with a group for some beers, sports and pool!
author: Heather H.

description:
The first time I walked into the Final Final I knew that I found my new neighborhood bar. 

Some of my reasons were
1. Two Pool Tables
2. Ample TV's
3. 20 Beers on Tap
4. Great weekend crowd - not to many MD's
5. Minnesota Vikings Bar (The Vikings part made this an easy sell for me)

This is probably one of the betters sports bars in San Francisco. With ample seating, and roughly 15-16 TV's, its a great place to get lost on a Saturday or Sunday.

Only drawback.......not a lot of food options. 

They do, however, have a killer hot dog, hot link or Polish Sausage for $3.50. (when you order, ask for the nacho cheese - its quite tasty) The wings are tasty as well.
author: Chris D.

description:
Sit back. Get a reasonably priced drink. Eat some free popcorn. Stare at one of the many TVs in the place. 

:-)
author: Gina G.

description: Went here to watch the vikings game this morning and it had a perfect blend of almost every fan base. Drinks came quick and were fair priced. Best thing is is they serve Papa Murphy's pizza. I will be back next Sunday.
author: Parker A.

description: Final Final is the best bar to watch sports, have a couple drinks, and connect with close friends. As a Nebraska native, I heard about this bar when I moved to California back in 2010. Saturdays in the fall are an excellent time to hit up Final Final, if you love Husker football. Arnie, Linda, and Michael are great and the jello shots aren't too bad either :) GO BIG RED!
author: Mackenzie K.

description: A couple months ago, after a run, I decided to pop into The Final Final for a rest.  The man behind the bar was very kind and attentive--best customer service I've received in months.  The feel of this bar along with Bruce Springsteen music in the background, is if you didn't know better--you'd think you were in a bar back in Allentown.
author: Tess C.

description:
I like competition. I like it even more when the person I'm competing with doesn't have a damn clue that I will totally win. This goes with men, especially. The game I like to play is, "How much can you get out of them without giving anything up (aka, your dignity)." 

Don't call me those names, that's not very nice.

Look, if the reason behind buying a girl a drink is to get her into bed, then what I'm doing should not make you go, "ohhh that's so fucked up." So is giving a girl an STD, but for some reason I don't see anyone getting offended by that. And if I truly believed they were interested in more than just sex, they wouldn't ask me to come home with them when it's over, and I wouldn't have tried to extort them out of free stuff.

Give me a break. I want a free drink because it is hard work thinking up ways to keep their hands off you and still manage to not pay for anything. Besides, doing all that on top of putting up with the bartender who had some type of attitude problem, half the softball team in an, as Quinn succintly put it, uncomfortably quiet post-game retreat and the rest being there to awkwardly pick up girls. Oh and one that can smack Amanda in the face because he's so tanked.

Why do I put myself in these situations? Well...because my feet hurt. And I had to use the bathroom. And Amanda was trashed. And this was the closest bar to the Exploratorium that my feet in heels could handle. And Jennifer was carrying me (I love you, btw) on her back because after about 5 minutes I almost passed out from pain on walking without shoes on. And because I love to rationalize like an emo, Hot-Topic wearing "No one understands me" 15 year old.

I could have chosen not to go to the Yelp Holiday Party. HA YEAH OKAY. 

I could have chosen not to go to the Final Final with Quinn, Jen and Amanda. But I love all three of them, so...HA YEAH OKAY. 

I could have chosen not to let Amanda try and introduce me to the guy buying me drinks all night. But she was trashed and I'm poor so...HA YEAH OKAY.

Obviously, judging by the fact that I woke up alone and very hungover, I won.

This game is depressing.
author: Jaime L.

description: I went to the Final for 8 years as a Lucafilm employee. It is a great place, a cozy neighborhood place with some bar snacks and a good selection of beer. The bartenders including Tim are very nice and professional. We used to call it building F, for pretty much the entire staff of the company would go there from time to time.
author: V T.

description:
For those of you who watch HIMYM, remember the Minnesota Walleye Saloon bar in the show where Marshall goes when he meets his family? Final Final is like that except it's a place for the Nebraska peeps. You're transported to Nebraska in the middle of SF. hehe. 

Walking into the bar, you're blinded by a sea of people wearing red. Everyone's a husker fan here. Guess that shouldn't be a surprise. During game days, it might be hard to grab a seat. So be sure you're ok standing up and watching the game. They have TVs on every wall, makes it easy for you to watch the game.
author: Cynthia C.

description: A classic neighborhood bar where the servers are friendly, the drinks are tasty, and the beer is always cold. The Final Final is a place where Men go to slam pitchers and shoot pool, and where the ladies go to get pounded. This dive bar is up there with some of the greatest, wielding it's very own popcorn machine that keeps the kernel firing on all cylinders. If you don't like popcorn, don't worry because they sell bagels with cream cheese and corndogs. It's probably the only place in the city where you can eat a corndog with one hand, hold a pool cue with the other, stare at a babe's poon while she bends over the bar to order an $11 pizza, and hit on the waitress with the huge knockers as she delivers you another pitcher.... All at the same time!
author: Greg C.

description:
Who knew that there was a portal to Nebraska in this bar.
Seriously....come during a college football game day and you'd forget you were in San Francisco. The normal Giants pride will be overtaken with love for Nebraska red. 

They have a great assortment of beers on tap. They also sell Pabst Blue Ribbon (in can form) for the frat boy in you. Oh so classy.
Food is also served which is a nice plus. Pizzas for around $12, nachos, wings, etc ($4-8). They even have a popcorn machine in the corner for you to help yourself with. Not bad!

Being that this is a sports bar you will find TONS of tvs EVERYWHERE in this place along with random sports memorabilia. I noticed that the owner was quite fond of football & baseball...but nothing related to basketball was seen. Interesting...
On crowded days waitresses&waiters look like chickens with no heads. Very frantic and hard to get their attention. But I give them props because they know what they are doing and are VERY good at their job!


I'm not a Nebraska fan so this place wasn't AMAZING to me...but if you happen to be one..then welcome home!
author: Paula L.

description:
During football season and basketball season, the Final can be full at 10 am on Saturday morning with fans of teams from the Midwest and East Coast.  Same with early pro games on Sunday.  Afternoon games are busy, and then at some point the evening crowd comes in to finish off the day.  In other words, this place isn't empty too often.

The crowd is what I might call Marina influenced, but pretty low key.  The bartenders hustle and do a great job in a very friendly way.
author: Nelson W.

description:
"Sit back down where you belong, in the corner of a my bar with your high heels on....there's something, something about my cool, Nebraska guy..."

Is it possible? Did Lady Gaga write You & I about the Final Final? I'd like to consider the possibility...

First of all, I'd like to apologize to the Final Final for a long, long overdue review of this amazing little joint on the corner of Lombard and Baker. The Final Final is our watering hole of choice prior to each and every Nebraska Husker football game. Come in on game days, and you're bound to see fans a plenty!

The bouncers at the Final Final are really, really nice guys. Although they were extremely crowded last night, the mind-set seemed to be "Eh, what's another Husker fan? Come on in!"

The crowd is always an eclectic mix of Nebraskans, or pseudo-Nebraskans (like myself) who are there for a good time, and to cheer on their team!

The staff are friendly, the drinks and food are priced just right, and it's always a good time! I dig the free popcorn in the corner! (Seems quite fitting...maybe a little corny! :)

See you next week when we play Ohio State!

PS: Only, only slight negative: It gets REALLY hot in here!
author: Annalise F.

description: Was here on Sunday watching the Giants grab victory over the Cardinals!  The atmosphere was great but Security is lax.  Someone pickpocketed me at the bar and stole away with $72.  And the bartenders and Security guy didn't seem too concerned like it happens regularly or something?  Anyway it's the first time I've been to Final Final and may be the final visit.
author: Liz O.

description:
Great name & location before I jump on the bridge. Really miss the horsecollar board  - Food here stinks but if you go to the final for food you're either ripped or enjoy eating frozen pizza cooked in a microwave. This is a bar people!!! - eat their free popcorn if you're hungry or better yet head up to Lils and get a bar burger. 

Love the Final Final
author: Matt T.

description: This is my favorite bar in SF, every time I come to see my friend we always come here. The staff is awesome and the people who hang out here are just as great. I come for few beers and a game of billiards and soon it becomes a fun night for all.
author: Stan R.

description: This is a REAL sports bar and it rocks.  They put the sound on for games! Awesome Bloody Mary's; cool/nice staff; FREE popcorn; great beer selection AND the bathrooms are very clean!  Unlike the hoity-toity sports bar down the road--The Republic--whose bathrooms smell like pee (and I've been there several times now to verify)!
author: Dre C.

description:
A sports bar that gets the details right.

Placed on the long end of Lombard, the Final Final is a welcome home for sports loving fans that need a weathered venue to enjoy a game.

Pitchers flow, the multiple screens glow, and the down home atmosphere makes this a personal favorite to catch a game. Whether it's the NFL playoffs or a ball game after work, rest assured you'll be surrounded by an easily excitable bunch that kicks it up a notch or two.

Free popcorn, a list of decent drink specials and a friendly staff sum it up. 

Beware of the red bull vodka flavor shot tasting. Things can get out hand. Fast.
author: Mike K.

description:
Went there one night to watch the F1 race - yes, they were kind enough to 
figure out which channel it was on and change the channel on one of the tv sets :)
author: Nikhil D.

description:
I recently joined a softball team with friends for the first time in AGES. Growing up summer softball was the thing in my home town, I loved softball and played every year. However, I was an awkward girl, I had no confidence, wasn't considered "cool," and wore bi-focals. My softball career focused more on the free ice cream after the game. 

Fast forward to 2009... I ooze confidence, consider myself cool (who cares what other people think), and  now wear contacts. And I quote from one of our games "I'm a fuckin athlete!" The best thing about "grown up" sports is the BOOZING. I have never been so athletic with such a high blood alcohol content in my life, and let me tell you, its the new steroid!  

And where do you get your roids after the game? Final Final... watch out for the Tuesday night softball crew. There is plenty of space for us to destroy with excess amounts of pitchers and pizzas.. and even cakes (If it's someones birthday) Darts, Pool, and popcorn also a plus!

Just don't ask the bartender for a buttery nipple
author: Hailey P.

description: If you're looking for a dive bar that has TV's, pool tables, darts, light beer on tap, and a decent jukebox, then this is your kind of place (that happens to be my kind of place).  It was recently mentioned in a list of best dive bars in the city.  I agree.
author: Jeff P.

description: We checked out this bar our last night in San Fran, early May.  First off, at $18 per draft pitcher, it is very expensive.  The two bartenders (older gentlemen) were friendly enough.  The beef I have is the lack of cleanliness in the bar itself.  Mostly, we were completely skeeved by the popcorn bowls.  Yes, you were treated to free bowls of popcorn, however, along with the popcorn you were handed a healthy serving of the last user's germs.  Each bowl had a ring of grime around the upper part which gave away the fact they are never washed.  I scraped the grime with my fingernail...ick.   Proof was apparent when we watched the waitress, twice, take bowls from the bar, wipe them off over a trash can with a towel, then place them back next to the popcorn machine.  No idea for what else that towel may have been used. I purposely put a wet napkin filled with who-knows-what in my bowl.  Again, it was dumped, wiped, replaced to popcorn machine.  No soap and water touches these bowls.  Between the price of draft and the laziness of the staff to clean, I would never return.
author: Joanne H.

description:
Met friends for a drink here last night and have only been the one time, but this place doesn't seem to deserve the negative reviews it's been getting lately. 

Service - Both the bartender and the waitress were pleasant and checked in with us frequently. 

Prices - About average (maybe slightly cheaper) for the marina

The place was busy but not uncomfortably crowded on a Friday night. Other customers were of all ages, but it was def. not a meat market (and note - it's in the Marina). Way fewer dbags than most places in the area. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to get here, but I'd stop in again if I was in the neighborhood. A good place to catch the game - lots of TVs.
author: Travis S.

description: Thank you to Final Final for giving me a piece of Idaho in California. If you are ever in Ketchum, Idaho go to the Casino and you will understand.  Big Buck hunter, cheap drinks, and the divey atmosphere make this place worth the trip!
author: Reid S.

description:
I hate to say it The Final Final is the sole reason the 49ers aren't in the superbowl. Seriously, who thought a sports bar would be so against their hometown football team?  So what am I talking about?

On a day we'd all like to forget - the day the niners lost - I ,a hardcore niners fan, and a few friends went to watch the game at a bar that boasts a plethora of tv screens. However, upon arriving I was refused entrance based on the claim that they were filled to capacity, which they were clearly not. I continued to reason that if the establishment truly cared about the 49ers they would let my friends in who by the way were standing in the pouring rain. They still refused despite every patron was visibly sitting within the bar.

All I have to say is if you care about the 49ers don't give this bar your money, they are clearly Seahawks fans. Lame lame Seahawks fans
author: Clint P.

description: Divey, but normal SF prices. This is a fun little (less/)non-pretentious stop in the area.
author: Joey S.

description: I like to crash down here after a night out downtown cause it's really close from where i'm staying, way livelier at week ends but bar staff always very friendly and carrying about their customers! Definitely worth the shot if you're around and dont know what to do :)
author: Exalt V.

description: This is as close to "Cheers" as you'll find in San Francisco.  The entire staff is extremely friendly, and they always make you feel like they've known you for years!  The service is fast, the price is right, and they always have all the best games on TV.  There is NO better place to watch a big game!
author: Joe S.

description:
I'm a local and I love hanging out at this bar.  If you are looking for an old school and easy going bar this is your place. There is always an interesting variety of people.  There are college kids, working professionals and even a few old locals. You can come in nice work clothes or old gym clothes and you won't stand out.  It has pool tables, darts, free popcorn and a few other foods for when you get the munchies. It has 5 or 6 TVs so if you are into sports....it's your place. Once I got to know the bartenders, I have loved it even more.  Sometimes I stop by just to say hi.   If you are looking for a fancy place, this is not for you. If you are looking for a casual place to go to a few times a week....this might be the one.

PS Ladies-There are always some stupid "players" hitting on us ladies but if you are smart you know better than to go home with them.
author: M B.

description:
F@%# all U trust fund babies!! worried about  popcorn on the floor!
If u knew how to order a drink the baldheaded bartender wold take care of  u! Have some respect 4 one man trying to quarantine 143  people!
welcome to the bay!!
author: DJ D.

description:
I'd give this place 4 stars for the awesome free, self-serve popcorn, but I'm sensing that it's uncool to give this place more than 3 stars. I mean, I don't want to make any Yelp enemies, but I've perused the 4+ star reviews of this place and they all seem to be written by really uncool people (sorry nerds!). I've also gotten a sense that people describe this as the "no bullshit, anti-Marina Marina bar," sort of like it's the "We'll stick a boot in your ass" neighbor to such douche-magnets as A16 (I've never been there but I like to be judgmental!). It made me feel like I was right at home at a sports bar in the midwest, with its tvs showing sports, sports memorabilia on the wall, and a black guy that looked like the Fridge, who as we all know is from sports.  

The only real drawback was that to play pool you have to first give your ID to the bartender to get the cue ball and then put quarters in the table to play. We got the cue ball just as someone else was putting in quarters, and shit almost led to straight up FISTICUFFS. Actually, I just kind of stood there doing a Kanye shrug outwardly being nice and explaining the situation to these older folk who tried to take the table while in my head saying "FUCK THESE PEOPLE I WILL FIGHT THEM TO THE DEATH OVER THIS POOL TABLE." They backed down and sat in the corner semi-uncomfortably while we gleefully played a round of pool in their faces. I mean, what can you do, you know? I then proceeded to stuff fistfulls of salted popcorn into my mouth while alternating between laughing and choking and trying to get pieces of kernel shell unstuck from between my teeth (why does popcorn have to fight me when I'm eating it?).
author: Joe T.

description:
It is what it is.

I've heard sportspeople of all ages and abilities utter those words in all situations (I think it's just to get sportswriters to go far, far away so they can get back to doing sportspeople things, like cocaine). Those words apply perfectly here.

Final Final is a dingy, wood-paneled sports bar in the Marina. This means it's full of polo-clad  white-hat doffing douches fresh from the frat house (with no humor whatsoever, thanks "you wanna step outside" man, i do in fact want to step outside and get far far away from here), heavier-set sugar-daddy looking types from Marin and the Marina alike, and then miscellaneous sorts of all stripes, all of whom like sports.

It is what it is, and it kinda sucks.
author: Chris R.

description: DEcently priced beers for SF standards, and free popcorn and pool tables!
author: Sam G.

description: Free popcorn, $3 polish dogs, pool tables, T.V.'s and beer, within a ten minute walk from home. What more could a girl ask for??
author: Kim P.

description:
The bartender on last night was a jack-hole.  The bar was practically empty, but when I first made eye contact (didn't even wave or open my mouth), he snapped, "I'll be with you in a few minutes," and then in some awkward act of discount contrition (or else he thought I overpaid), he threw back one of the three fives I gave him (literally threw it, and as much at me as onto the bar) on a $10.25 tab, and then gave me $4.75 in change.  I guess math isn't his thing.  

The bar was populated half by an uncomfortably quiet post-game softball team and half by pathetic, lonely, typical Marina dudes, one of whom took my friend home after 20 minutes and three drinks (her therapist tells her she has little to no standards), and another who inadvertently punched a friend in the face while trying to flirt with her.  You should have seen the look on his face as he stumbled backward when I asked her if she was going to punch him back or should I.

Oh, and they have popcorn and a pool table.
author: Quinn S.

description:
So, it was pointed out to me, by one of my very favorite fellow drinkers (you may know him as the guy who passed out at my last party with his hand down his pants) that I am slipping. 

Apparently I wrote 7 reviews in a row, none of which were about drinking establishments. The shame. So, in order to restore my lack of dignity I am cranking out a few reviews I have put off writing. 

This one is hard to write because I really want to like this place. I really do. Really. 

The Final Final is near my place and has a really nice owner. They have free popcorn, two pool tables, video golf (which is one of the few video games I actually like playing... only because I was coerced into liking it with a whole lot of pot in college), and Papa Johns pizza, which is much better than you can imagine when you're three sheets to the wind. 

However, they have one bartender who irks me so much that in order to tolerate her I end up racking up a $100 bar tab every time I am in the place. 

Then there are the guys who throw out lines like "Are you drunk enough that I can take your fine ass home yet?" or "Want to walk down the street to my hotel and get high?".

I would rather spend my $100 on a round trip Greyhound ticket to drink for an evening in Bakersfield than spend any more time here....but, one extra star for the owner and the pizza.
author: Drue C.

description:
When I was young I did stupid shit. I also did stupid shit three years ago. One of the dumb things I did three years ago was leave my friends here and get in a van - yes, a FUCKING VAN - when I was wasted with two strange guys so we could smoke pot. They also gave me a ride home, though they wouldn't listen to directions and we ended up almost at Ocean Beach when I freaked the fuck out and insisted that they turn around and bring me home. Luckily I carry a buck knife and open it and slide it into my sleeve when I'm uncomfortable - even more luckily, I didn't have to use it.

I don't smoke pot anymore. But I'll still come here occasionally. It's not my favorite destination, but it will do sometimes.
author: Suge K.

description:
Are you kidding me? How come no one has told me about this place?

I know, it's not a bar you would go to on a typical Friday / Saturday night unless you play some kind of sport. I was here! 

Yes, on a Thursday night after a softball game.... and boy ...was I surprise. It's effening great for.... after a win or a loss. Who cares? You got good company and great prices on drinks. It's ideal for groups especially for folks like me who love sports in general. That's all I can say.

I'm not mentioning we lost BIG time.
author: Stanley K.

description:
On this past Columbus Day, I had the day off.  Nobody else that I knew did, so I had nothing to do.  So I just rode the MUNI all day.  Near the end of the day, I felt like catching MNF, so I hoped off the bus, looked up the nearest sports bar, and found this place.

Not...too...shabby.  A good selection of $5 pints.  Random odd patrons (one of whom left a 5c tip).  A funny bartender.  And big ass TVs.  I don't know if I'll ever be in this neighborhood again, but if I am...I might ponder visiting again ;)
author: Robert S.

description:
This was our afterwork local when I worked across the street.  In fact, it was practically an extension of our office.  As a sports bar, or a local, it's great.  
As a stumbling block after a drunken Yelp holiday party it's maybe not so good.
I had a drink, kissed some people, watched someone work her flirt, watched someone else punch a guy in the face, and ate the hell out of some popcorn all while getting odd stares from the group of people who actually looked like they belonged there.  I love random.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
The bartender almost made my male friend (and possibly a whole table of soccer players) cry. 

Never, I say, NEVER try to open the popcorn machine door when this little hussy is around. She'll promptly snap your head off like the praying mantis she is. If you're lucky, she may even call you an asshole, for FREE!

But the beer was cold, the popcorn was light and fluffy, with a plenty of half-popped kernels for me to crack my teeth on (I love me some half-pops), and the majority of the men are wearing tank-tops (in January?). The Final Final is ok by me as long as there are men in tank-tops to mock within earshot...ya, I'm mean. But tank-tops? really?
author: Sammy S.

description:
From the outside, I always thought this place was a dive, kinda ghetto, kinda dirty.  But there always seems to be people going in and out of it, so with friends from out of town in tow, we decided to hit this place up.

Actually, it's pretty nice inside!  It was crowded, but not too crowded that it was uncomfortable.  We were able to sit at a table and talk amongst each other without having to scream.  I found the digital jukebox to be pretty cool, and it provided awesome jams all night.  Towards the back is an area to play darts, a few pool tables, and free popcorn.  The service was great, this girl constantly kept coming back to check up on us.
Plus, this might sound strange, but there was surprisingly a large girl to guy ratio.  I don't know if it's just me, but most bars I've been to around the city has always been somewhat of a huge sausagefest.  The crowd was pretty nice, it just seemed like everyone was there to have a good time .  All in all, an actually chill place to hang out!
author: Crys L.

description:
Not annoying.  

Good vibe, solid bartenders, fun jukebox.  In that random corner of Cow Hollow/Marina, this place is definitely a welcome respite from he regular Marina bar scene.
author: Audrey T.

description:
thumbs up:
lots of tvs
free popcorn
lots of beers on tap, including all my girlie faves (blue moon, hoegaarden, pear cider)
convenient location for house of air trampoline dodgeball post drinks 

thumbs down:
$5.50 beers.  why not just $5?  i hate spare change.
they closed at 11 on a weds as it was "not busy enough"
author: Josie M.

description: Fairly standard dive/sports bar.  Doesn't have any drink specials or happy hours though.  Crowd is really diverse.  Sometimes the place can be dead empty.  Other nights, it's packed.  Lots of TVs and always showing a wide range of sports.  Apparently, it's a Nebraska Huskers bar on Saturdays during college football season.
author: Derek L.

description:
I like the fact that I can come here dressed to the nines right out of the ballet and hang out with lots of good ol' Irish boys and New Zealand rugby players. No pre-tense, just a good juke-box, popcorn, and stiff drinks. 

And it truly lives up to it's name as it's impossible to make it to any other location for the rest of the evening.
author: Yelper A.

description:
Great place to shoot pool, throw some darts and chill.

It almost never gets ridiculously crowded with assholes...almost...and when it does I'm generally one of them.
author: Jay W.

description:
Why is there a place like this nasty, trashy, straight out of some trailer park scene here, right next to my apartment, in this beautiful city of San Francisco where people talk about food and wine flows?

Why do people that come here dress like tourists from middle America in Vegas or at Disneyland? Why do they act like straight out of nasty fat people beer commercial?

Please go away from my sight this nasty nasty bar.
author: Kokoro I.

description:
Went here with a large group in the late afternoon. Bartender was super cool. Not a real big place, but it was pretty cool. Bartender made us a bunch of shoots and kept the pitcher of beer full.
We got a few snacks and it was your typical bar grub. I will have to go back and check out a game here.
author: Lisa A.

description:
This is a great football game day place to watch a game.  I'm a Nebraska fan and what can  I say...this is the place to be!  The only better thing would be if they served runzas & Valentino's pizza.  

It can be brutally hot and crowded and at times hard to get a drink so come early if you want to get a seat and have a server.  The people are really friendly though and it's definitely a good place if you're into college football.  

It's located off Baker so not a ton of parking, but I can say the times I went I did find spaces.
author: Kim D.

description:
Well, it's where all the Texas fans go to watch the game. It almost feels like Austin, it's really a collection of younger alumni that took finance or tech jobs in the city - at least on Saturday afternoons.

The service is just....really, really slow. But it's fine, if you're there for games, it'll be 3.5 hours, so think of it as self moderation.  It doesn't feel like a dive (how many dives are covered in HD flat panels?), it just feels like a casual sports bar...where what's on the TV is more important than the label on the clothes you're wearing.
author: Joe K.

description:
Went last night after yet another Christmas party.  It was fun, I love the free popcorn in the back, and they have pool tables.  It is absolutely a neighborhood bar, no pretentions here.  However, the bartender had a bit of attitude, kept freaking out when a kernel of popcorn got onto the pool table and was in general, pretty stressed out.

I like how they have so many chairs, play decent tunes, and that there were FOUR rolls of toilet paper in the girls stall, all on individual toilet paper holders.  Even on a busy night, you wouln't be left without a square or two.

This isn't a destination bar, but if you are in the neighborhood, want a beer or to play pool, Final Final is a great option!
author: Julie H.

description:
Great hangout!  Free popcorn, dartboard, pool tables, (good) cheap beer.  Don't try eating here though, everything's microwaved.  

Crowd can be kind of off some nights though.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
I love this classic dive bar! Good sports to watch, pool, beer is always cold. I will never pass up the opportunity to go enjoy all of the above when the occasion arises.

Sadly, they lost a star for me. Last night the bar was flooded with large men in tank tops. Normally, I'm ok with tank tops and/or large men. But combine the two and my up chuck reflex was in full force.

Men, wear the tank top loud and proud. But save it for the gym, the beach or even a game of tennis. But keep it out of my frosty beer and not standing in front of the TV where I am watching the Chargers lose.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Whatever you do, don't eat here. Sure, I know I should blame myself for eating here, but seriously, they microwave everything. I watch a LOT of college football here (big 10 fan, games start at 9am Pacific), and I made the mistake of ordering bagels here once. I think he microwaved the bagel. I'm not joking. He also microwaved the cream cheese.

The bald guy (Arnie, I think) is just plain hormonal. Its hard to tell how pleasant he's gonna be, or whether he's gonna put your game on. The Ohio State bartender, is also kinda quirky. Oh well...

I also doubt the hygeine factor here. But, then again, after a few beers who cares, right?

BTW, just for the record, this *is* a UT bar. Also, a Purdue bar. 

Go Boilers!

"ai"
author: Anand I.

description:
This place is sick and even more so if your a die hard Niners fan or Giants fan. They have this place deiced out with nothing but niners and giants stuff all over the walls of this bar. 
The bar is fully equipped with a popcorn machine that is full of popcorn for the drinkers to fill a bowl. The pool tables (2) are spaced nice and the tunes are great. We went on a Thursday night and the place was busy with locals from the close by neighborhood. The beers were cheap and the staff was the best. Even though I despise the Giants I had a great time and will come back to catch a game or just to drink.
author: Armando G.

description:
sports bar (n)
a bar or tavern featuring numerous television sets which allow patrons to watch a variety of sporting events, order food from the bar menu, and possibly enjoy a game of billiards or darts 

Fits the definition.
author: Adam W.

description:
As a new resident to the great city of  San Francisco I decided to try to meet new people by signing up with a softball league by myself.  The first couple of games were fun, but I felt slightly awkward playing on a team with a bunch of strangers.  A few games into the season, we started meeting up at Final Final for a few post-game beers.  The Final Final provided a cozy and homie atmosphere which was perfect for bonding with my Softball teammates.  The popcorn fed our hungry apetites and the pitchers of beer were bountiful.  Final Final was a great conduit for bonding with my soon to be championship softball league teammates and getting to know some great people.  

This place has several pool tables and plenty of TV's for watching your favoirte sports team.  Beware of obnoxiously loud fans during college basketball season, but overall people are pretty laid back.  I've had no problems with the bartenders that other people complain about, they've been nothing but friendly to me.  My only complaint is that parking is a bitch, but that is what you get in the Presidio/Marina area.
author: Patrick N.

description: Nice dive bar away from some of the noise in the city. Plenty of space, nice jukebox selections, and happy employees makes the Final Final a great place to hang out.
author: Brandon R.

description:
The only reason the Final Final gets three stars is because their jukebox actually played my songs I requested.
Otherwise the place is a dive and I am not a fan (so I guess this review is already biased).  I don't even think this could be a last stop on a long night of drinking.  
When I move to SF there will be hundreds of other places I can go to over this joint.  And fyi...don't order a White Russian...not good.
author: Sheila Y.

description:
we love your bar but due to recent events, you guys really need to have a bouncer to take care of overly drunk, aggressive patrons.  also, cut them off when they can barely stand!  
we come here to watch sporting events, and we know that people come here to have some drinks and a good time but it gets uncomfortable when someone is so drunk that they cant recognize that you don't want them to put their hand on your leg!  
like i said, a bouncer would have been helpful.
author: Ciara W.

description:
Thank you Final Final for all the great times.  Don't usually remember leaving, but always remember how excited I am when I arrive.  Pool, popcorn, beer and Big Ten Football.  

Did I miss anything?  Do you need anything else?
author: Cal H.

description:
Wow, okay it's been a while since I was here.  

Total dive bar.  This is a place where I get trashed with my girl friends, play pool and talk trash. 

Not much else to it.
author: Inga B.

description:
Pitcher of beer $10.00,  hot dog  $ don't know but took a bite of my friends, Jukebox beats $1.00 
Final Final- First and Final time I will go there
author: Ricquel N.

description:
One of the better sports bars in the City (ok, there are only 3 true sports bars here).  Decent televisions for watching games - satellite packages can get just about any game televised (and they aren't pricks about turning on your game).  Despite what some Yelpers say, the bartenders are really friendly.  They just don't put up with a lot of the BS that Marina Elitists tend to bring with them (sorry d-bags, Bar None is probably more your scene).  This is a place to drink beer and pay cash.  

Oh yeah - free popcorn, good jukebox and pool tables!
author: Kevin M.

description:
Word up to Final Final for keeping it real.  Real friendly and real chill.  According to my SF native friends, they used to hit up this place 10 years ago when business was slow going. And according to the real locals, even through its rise in popularity FF has maintained its og flavor.

I've been a fan of FF for about 5 years now. And Tim is the best bartender in the world in my book. He really takes care of his peeps. This man is loved and respected by anyone who has had the chance to get to know him. And oh momma mia- can he whip up an awesome "slightly dirty" kettle one martini. Tip the man well!

From darts to the pool table to simply shooting the sh*t at the bar, this bar is the Cheers of SF. Where everyone is welcome.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Shitty sports/dive bar with a shitty bartender.  Perhaps my impression of this bar would have been different, had the bartender not acted like a douche on the first drink I ordered.

I asked for a black & tan. He pours and says $5.50.  I pull $7 out of my wallet, give him $6 and put $1 down on the bar.  He grabs the $1 and walks to the cash register.  He does not come back with my 50 cents.  

Now, I didn't say anything...I mean, who starts a scene over 50 cents?  But I was still put off by his assumption that I didn't want change.

When I recounted the story to my friend who's been here before, he didn't seem at all surprised and said the bartender has been known to yell at people for leaning on the pool table or standing where he needed to walk.

He can shove his shitty little bar far up his royal ass for all I care -- I won't be coming back here.
author: Eugene F.

description: Cool sportsbar in a great neighborhood!  Love the free popcorn and plenty of TVs.
author: Lisa P.

description:
The owner/manager of this place (bald guy who works behind the bar) is a huge penis.  It's a bummer because this place can be a cool spot to watch games.  Just hope that your game is on because there is no way he will be put out and actually change the channel.  

I probably won't go back to this place unless I am dragged here by my friends and in that situation I will probably try and take a dump in the corner or in front of the owner's office.
author: Michael N.

description:
Its a fun little joint,  and the waiter was very friendly but the old school wheelchair inaccessible bathroom put a damper on my time there.  

It's 2008 step it up Final Final!
author: Tom K.

description: This place was as good as it got for a local hangout in San Fran (when you lived in the Presidio). Popcorn and beer are such a great combo! I can't wait to move back into the Bay area and chill at this spot again!
author: Britt P.

description:
3 Words -- Pitchers of Beer
3 More Words -- Costco Frozen Food

You don't come here to eat, you come here to drink beer.  And drink beer we do!  The free popcorn works in their favor, as I drink more because of all of its lovely saltiness.  Perfect post-softball or volleyball team spot during the week.  LOTS of sports on the tubes here -- hockey, soccer, strong man competitions, blah, blah, blah.  If it's televised, it's here.

It's hilarious, as 98% of the patrons are in their sporting scrubs, but inevitably you see 2% Marina girls lookin' cute and ready for action.  Their intentions stick out, but it adds to the jocularity of the place.
author: Karen C.

description:
Ladies, steer clear of here for your Sunday Funday....just go to Jones. The guys are here to watch the game and would rather not hear you squealing or be bothered by your questions....."How do they not trip over the yellow line?"

The only real sports bar in the Marina, the beer is cold and the popcorn is hot. Go Niners!
author: Rachael W.
