description: Attentive wait staff. Lots of TVs. We were able to catch up on our hockey, soccer, football, and watch the giants game all at once. Great vibe. Good prices. FREE POPCORN. Although their menu isn't extensive, it gets the job done. We will definitely be back!
author: Jordan C.

description: Easily my favorite dive bar in SF. The decor is authentic and the vibe is certainly not pretentious like the marina. I love it here and it used to be the Iowa Hawkeyes gamewatch bar. No more I'm guessing, but our Iowa alum friends didn't mind one bit. Buttery popcorn to wash down ice cold drinks. What's not to like? Oh, and the jukebox will play all the oldies and even some newer goodies. Sweet!
author: Evie B.

description: This bar was literally around the corner from my home of 3 years and I would visit it occasionally to grab a light snack and a cool beverage.  It's a little too "sportsy" for my tastes, but the pool table and pizza and nachos are just what you need for a snack on a cool San Francisco Day.
author: Dave M.

description: This is more like a 3.5 but I'll round up. Great place to watch Nebraska football. The drinks ehre aren't anything special and are a little overpriced. It always gets crowded, but you usually can find a seat. Free popcorn, too. The food looks lousy, but they don't try to BS you here - they fully advertise that they're serving Papa Murphy's pizza. Out of the way location results in easy parking usually too.
author: Mark A.

description:
Dear Final Final,
You are the bar around the corner from me.  You've never been the first bar in my evening, but you are sometimes the best.  You are always good for the night's last ticket to blackoutedness.  

Thanks.  
PS.  I'm sorry I brought my friend to you and you had to call the police to get him out.  I'm sorry about the things he stole and the things he said.  You are my neighborhood bar, I want no hard feelings.   I won't bring him back ever again.
author: N D.

description:
The eyes of Texas are upon you, all the livelong day...

A Texas Exes bar, what more could you ask for?

Texas v. Nebraska game:
23 seconds left and they get a backup and first time kicker, Ryan Bailey, setting up for field goal. Just as his leg swings back, the cable goes black, luckily he kicked a 22-yard field goal to lead the Longhorns to a 22-20 victory over the Cornhuskers in a Big 12 showdown. 

Other than that mishap, the bar food is what it is, greasy, grubbin' and relatively good bar food. Note: duck for cover, if the bartender yells out "We're out of Shiner!" 

Get here early or else you might have to stand near the other team's fans. O Who?

Give em hell, give em hell, make em eat $***!
author: Kristina L.

description:
Beer and sports.  Sports and Beer. Done and done.  

Now that the Marina Sports Bar is gone, Final Final is really the only good sports bar in the neighborhood.  As an added bonus, this is the one place in my neighborhood that our non-marina friends are actually excited to go.
author: Amanda B.

description:
I like a good bar kick back bar as much as the next person. Comfortable, non pretencious, laid back. This place is fun and spacious. Free popcorn and a pool table always make for a good night. 

Beware bartender can make any grown man cry. She tends to be pretty rude.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
Rock Chalk Jayhawk!

4 stars for this place just because I got to watch KU go 10-0 here!

Overall, I think this place is good for watching football games since it doesn't get over-crowded like some of the other sports bars in my area (even during USC-Cal weekend).  Have some decent pub food as well (I had the combo pizza).

Decent # of TVs and different games playing.
author: Sam H.

description:
Final, Final? What the heck does that mean?! Rumor has it, this is the last stop en route to the bridge for you to have your "final, final" drink... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zwl-Pa_QT0M

Don't even think about ordering food here unless you crave microwaved chicken wings and pizza that a starving homeless person would turn down. Grab a handful of the free popcorn instead. Shoot pool, drink beer, watch football... that's what you do here.
author: Dave L.

description:
Really laid back bar.  Pool, good jukebox, cheap drinks.  Everyone's really nice.  

I came here on NYE...weird I know.  But it was great.  My friends were having a party here and so it wasn't sceney or crowded or overpriced...like most NYE parties.

I've come a few other times randomly and I love that there's always seats... I know I'm lazy but I'm usually wearing heels :)
author: Angela S.

description:
Good beer, good TVs, good service, and enough room to roam.

Its the usual sports bar. Don't expect to be blown away.

See you there!
author: Jon C.

description:
The place to watch the Kentucky Derby, drink lotsa beer, eat popcorn and one scream at the end. Well, it was a fun afternoon.

Guess the namesake is for those Marin tunnellers to tell em it's yo final final place for a buzz till you head out onto the Golden Gate.
author: miriam b.

description: I see a lot of people talking about polo-wearing douche bags at this bar, but I've NEVER had that experience. It's usually older locals out on the town for some beers and friendly conversation. The jukebox has some amazing options and The Final Final has HANDS DOWN the nicest bartender in town (I think his name is Tim). If you're looking for a hole-in-the-wall to hang out with friends that offers a pool table, darts and won't get super crowded on a Friday or Saturday night, The Final Final is your spot.
author: Carrie C.

description: Marina attitudes? Nope, all left at the door. So relax because now you are in a neighborhood bar. The place is just chill, as is the decor and very clean.  There are TV's showing the major activities and even better a jukebox that has a wide enough variety to keep me entertained. The place is spacious and has two pool tables and two dart boards and with a good bartender... what more do you need?
author: Natasha M.

description:
Went here while in town for business and enjoyed it.  The bad part of the visit was the fact that the Cleveland Browns were pulverizing the New York Giants on the tube.

Other than that, the free popcorn, pool tables, beer on tap (love the Anchor Steam) and relaxed dive-bar atmosphere reminded me of some of the similar establishments I enjoy back in New York.
author: Preston J.

description:
Constantly understaffed. 

"Can I order some food?", "No, if you order than everyone else will order."

I don't see why the cheap owner can't afford an extra $9 an hour to adequately serve it's customers. No reason to go to this bar, plenty of better options.

Popcorn is nice, though.
author: RJ S.

description:
I can't believe that one of these reviews said "they didn't shake my drink right."   If you are seriously looking for a good appletini at a sports bar, you are barking up the wrong tree.

Pretty much the quintessential sports bar.
author: Cully W.

description:
Actually Stan, we got blown out big time after our first game....but going to Final Final helped to resolve the bitterness of losing.

Our softball team has been coming here after games since last fall.  It is a cozy place, has a juke box and a couple pool tables. The Juke box can be fun, especially to initiate dances with the drunker girls on your softball team.

Bartender is ok, just don't order food as it seems to tick him off (I have order a couple times...he just sighs and shakes his head).....

fun place to wrap up for softball....
author: Shaun O.

description:
To me, this is a perfect sports bar.  Nice and chill on the inside, decent number of TVs and pretty good food (for a bar).

I like their selection of beer on tap, enjoy their pool tables in the back, and best of all, they have Golden Tee!  Bartenders are always friendly and quick to refill your drink.

Very cool neighborhood sports bar.
author: Bobby J.

description:
meh. Me and some friends came in looking for something to eat that wasnt too expensive (aka not the such-and-such bistro or cafe with fancy stuff and high prices). unfortunately, there was no tacqueria within striking distance, so we wandered into this place to see if they had food. Well, they do, but it was pretty bad pizza and pretty bad wings. 

And the service was TERRIBLE. The bartender seemed genuinely pissed that she had to do whatever it was that was required to prepare the shitty pizza and wings, and didnt even leave the bar to bring us our pitcher or our food, just put it on the counter and gestured us towards it. 

Maybe it deserves more stars by its merits of being a bar, but we didn't stay long enough to find out. 

1/2 star for the popcorn machine though, that was nice to have around.
author: Dan M.

description:
Fine sports bar, no seats
Good hot wings and pork sandwich
Must enjoy football.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Since I do not live in San Francisco anymore - I completely forgot about this place until a friend sent me a birthday evite here.  I used to go to this place quite often - yes it is a dive bar, but I have to say - I made many great friends here playing pool and drinking some beers.  I even spent one or two New Years Eve's here - which were very fun

We usually made it our final stop on the way home as did may other people - hence the name.   I also occasionaly came here after indoor hockey games with the team.  If you are looking for a sleek, clean place with fancy drinks - this is NOT the place to go - it is  definitly a dive bar, but a great dive bar.  THey have free popcorn coming from a machine in the back corner and drink prices are reasonable and the staff was very friendly - it has been a few years since I have been here, so some things may have changed but I will make it an effort to go back on my next visit.
author: jane f.

description: This place refused to let me in with leftovers from dinner when I was going to buy a round of drinks for my friends. Plenty of other sports bars with better policies in sf.
author: Brain W.

description:
Come on, this is a bar bar.
Should it even get a review?  A neighborhood joint with lots of Lucasville interlopers these days.

Still no complaints, but if you are going to hit on my wife at least buy me a beer.
author: David R.

description:
Typical sports bar with typical people...

Nothing special here...  free popcorn is kinda cool, there are a ton of TV's and a couple of pool tables.  

I could see myself spending a lot of time here if I lived nearby.

Some one had hijacked the jukebox and I got a little tired of their pop selections.

The bar staff are friendly enough.  

Like I said, nothing special here.
author: Tony A.

description: Takes balls to charge $3 for a 12 oz can of PBR and call it a "special" -- so well done.
author: Adam Z.

description: I've been living in the city for 5 years now and have experienced my fair share of bars.  This one's my favorite for NUMEROUS reasons.  1. Tim's awesome.  2. Games 3. Pretty decent prices for the city 4. NOT your typical Marina Douchebag bar, or mission emo-band playing dive.  This place is "real" and it's laid back.  The FOOD rocks, the TV's and games especially rock.  Its on top of my list.  Its comfortable.
author: Molly R.

description:
I just visited this place for the first time this last weekend and was very happy to see that there were plenty of TVs which was perfect for watching the game; the drink selection was pretty ok as well. 

The bar is small, so it can get packed pretty quickly, leaving only standing room. The free popcorn was nice, but as for the food food, I wouldn't waste your money. The pizza looked pretty good, but I tried out the philly cheese steak sandwich instead. When it came out, it looked pretty pathetic. It looked like an over-microwaved hot dog bun with some meat in it, and that's exactly how it tasted; there were no onions or peppers as I typically expect phillys to have...My boyfriend went for the nachos. They aren't the kind of nachos that are loaded with goodies like olives and sour cream and the works; they are the kind of nachos you get at a gas station - chips, cheese, and jalapenos. 

Even though the food left much to be desired, the prices were awesome! If you're lookin for a place to just catch the game and a few drinks with a bunch of loud and energetic fans, this is the perfect place for such an occasion.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Good beer, good cocktails, great jukebox, pool, darts, and all the popcorn you can eat while in a state of poor judgement.  As a dive bar, it gets the job done.  

Bartenders are a little weird.  Especially the blonde.  But overall, fun neighborhood bar to chill with co-workers and get a little sauced.  :-)  I've had some great times there.
author: David C.

description: Came here on a Sunday morning, bartenders were pretty cool and the drinks were decently priced. I was slightly distracted by the raging USC fans, but still enjoyed this slightly divey sports bar nonetheless. They have darts, and darts fucking rule!
author: Matt F.

description: If your idea of a good night is a bunch of 20 something yuppies who look you up and down every time you try to grab a drink or place a food order, go here.  Effing lame.  And their popcorn machine is exploded everywhere, popcorn all over the place, people just plunging their hands into the machine.  Gross.
author: Claire C.

description:
oh the final. i drink here way too much. I am friends with one of the bartenders, Nadine.  She is really really awesome.
 
Here is a typical final night:
Starts with plans to meet friends here. Friends are boys, boys flake and are late, Natalie gets mad.
Natalie decides to take shots.
Natalie manages to make friends with the two funniest most awkward guys in the bar, and gets many free shots of Jameson.  why are boys impressed by girls who like whiskey? its dumb. back to the story: Natalie starts to make phone calls and leave angry messages. she tells her friends "its over, we are not friends any more." Natalie's friends show up, Natalie buys them a double shot of well gin as punishment for being fucktards. Friend drinks shot with a straw.  
We squint at each other.  Random guys don't realize Natalie's friends have arrived, and keep talking to her about how she is awesome. 
Bar fills up with white boys. Some random girl tells Natalie to pull up her pants because her crack is showing. Natalie complies, thinks girl is just jealous. Natalie is very drunk and hands friend purse and runs to bathroom.  She does not puke, but salivates heavily.
Returns to bar, "hey guys! I didn't Puke!"  
"oh, you will"
Natalie wants to leave.  Friend agrees, says goodbye to random guys who ask for email address, not phone number, email address.
and... Scene.
Consolatory emails were sent to friends the next morning. Still waiting on that email from the random guys.
I swear I'm not an alcoholic.
author: Natalie K.

description: Popcorn everywhere is my lasting impression of this place. Service was sort of slow and inattentive but I didn't much care - it is a sportsbar after all. I paid 18 for a beer and someone's drink, which is costly, although it could have been a double (that punk). Manchester United was on screen and even though Manure blows I will give the bar props for playing Premier League Football on a Saturday evening. Good place for a drink in the area but no destination.
author: Sven S.

description: Great dive bar to grab a drinks with some buddies and watch a game. There is popcorn to munch on and a limited menu of microwaveable foods. The place is not the cleanest, but that is why it is a dive bar. Not sure about the "douche bag" comments about this place. When I think of Marina douche bags, I think of Mas Saki or Matrix. This is definitely a different crowd. I assume that most of the bad reviews of this place are from people looking for something other than what this place has to offer.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Tough to hate on Final Final, which is the Screaming Ninjas (Thursday Night Rec League Volleyball Co-Ed Regular Season Champions) preferred post-win watering hole.  I love the bartender, who insults patrons under his breath if you don't say please or thank you.  My kind of guy!
author: Matt S.

description: Didn't shake my drink right and way too expensive, $6.50 for a stoli??? Come on, this is a sports bar. Super slow service, and it wasn't a packed house, i wont hold it against them forever, it is super bowl Sunday, they were a bit more interested in the game than my drink.
author: Rachel L.

description: It's the closest bar to my house. They have not one, but TWO pool tables. They have darts. They serve food. They have pacman. They have FREE popcorn! I love this place.  It's also CRAZY packed on saturday afternoons when UT is playing.
author: Mark G.

description: The smell of popcorn, old 49ers memorabilia on the walls (I so miss the Sefeirt, Montana, and Rice days--damn I'm old), and Robert Johnson on the jukebox make this bar one of my Favorite Favorites.
author: Gretchen T.

description: Nice welcoming bar hidden in cow hollow.  Cheap drinks, friendly bartender, two pool tables, darts, and tasty popcorn.  I would NOT recommend getting food at the Final Final though.
author: Allison S.

description: Always stop in here on our way out on the town, the drinks are tasty and it is relatively spacious for a city establishment. Not many ladies however so it is definitly BYOB "Bring You Own Bush".
author: Tabor, S.

description: Great place as long as it's not crowded by the after-softball crowd.  Beers are a little expensive but the dartboard, popcorn and internet jukebox make up for that.  Good times.
author: Rob K.

description: Love the free popcorn.. oh, yeah, and all the tv's featuring sports, the 2 pool tables and dart board in the back area - cool hangout.  Okay for dates but better for meeting new people :)
author: Allison B.

description: This is nearly the perfect neighborhood bar.  Away from Union or Chestnut Street, this place seems to be able to avoid the obnoxious bar people that bounce from place to place.  I don't recommend the food, but this is a bar.
author: Zachary S.

description: God bless the rare jewel that is the unassuming, non-trendy, non-themed, non-Asian-Fusion, non-small plates establishment.  This is the kind of bar that makes me feel like I'm back in Wyoming, cocktailing at the Lander Bar (minus the drunk cops asking for roadies on their way out the door).  Two pool tables, free popcorn, darts, jukebox and 20 beers on tap makes this one of the best low-brow nights out in the city.
author: Katie C.

description: The Final Final has been my college football bar for years. Somehow, the wait staff always gets our drinks and weaves through the packed bar. For some reason, the Texas alumni have stopped going there, and I refuse to go anywhere else. The Final Final has been great. The food is not so good but you can bring in your own.
author: Melissa A.

description: I agree w/ Sarah -  very chill.  A cool place for Marina and anti- Marina folks to co-exist.
author: greg e.

description: College dive-bar feeling, jukebox, dart boards, pool tables, hot popcorn in the corner with a bitchy waitress and loud patrons.  These are a few of my favorite things!  Not a "hey let's go there tonight!" place but if you happen to be in walking distance, chiggity check it out.
author: Allison K.

description: Love this Bar.  It doesn't feel like you are in SF, and especially not in the Marina.  It is a great place to grab a couple beers (they have at least 20 on tap), and there is always an interesting crowd on hand.  Also, it is as likely to be packed on a tuesday night as it is on a saturday.  Grab a stool, some popcorn and enjoy the friendly atmosphere.
author: Robert R.

description: A lot of the softball leagues I've played in play their games in the Presidio, which makes the Final Final the post-game drinking destination.  I've spent many a night here, especially with teammates with a proclivity for ordering tequila shots to forget the drubbing we just endured.  The popcorn bowls are endless.  The pizzas are frozen, but do the job.  There is little more that a simple man like me can ask of the Final Final.  I've always gone home happy, even if we lost the game.
author: Beau G.

description: You'd think you could have a good time in a bar with free popcorn but the staff do a good job and nulling any good mood. The place always has the cleanliness of a teenagers bedroom but we're told that coasters must be used. The barman seems less interested in cleaning the bar and more in eyeing the pool tables to shout across the whole bar if someone is tempted to rest a water on the side of the table.
author: Dan C.

description:
fun dive bar... i seem to always drink a bit too much when i go there... ! so if that's good, you'll like it, if not, you won't 

happy sailing
author: Scott K.

description: It's true. It's a bunch of douche bags. Even the slow, rude bartenders. I cannot tell a lie. Oh well, there are a lot of TV's if you're a sports fan, hence the extra star. That's pretty much it. Nothing really good to say. If you like guys with a lot of gel in there hair and old man shoes, and bartenders who act like it's a chore to serve you, this is your place.
author: Ryan M.

description: Nothing makes me happier Monday nights after an intense softball game than a Guiness with my team at this lovely establishment.  Very chill spot, TVs for the big game, and complimentary popcorn...forget about it!
author: Sarah D.

description: This is not the XYZ bar. They have PBR and the Champagne of beers, plus bowls of pop corn. Let freedom ring.
author: Raymond M.

description:
I had the distinct displeasure of going into the Final Final early on a  week day a couple of months ago. The bar was empty and I was the only one there. I asked the balding old bartender for a coffee drink. He rudely with a sound of irritation told me to go up the street for coffee. I have been a customer of this bar for 22 years or more and live a block away. I have brought many peep's there over the years. I deserved a pleasant refusal at the minimum. Had I ever been any kind of problem over the years, I could have understood his distasteful reaction to my request. 

      I found out that he lives in Marin and does not give a tinkers damn about folks in the old SF tradition of neighborhood. In the 22 years of my patronage there he has bought me one drink and I almost fainted. I will not annoy him again.
author: Jack J.

description: Fun time to watch college football - probably a great place to watch any sport for that matter.  Has a very neighborhood-bar feel to it.  Didn't try any of the bar food but the friends I were with had the pizza and I can't say it looked the greatest, but you should be coming to this place for the experience and not the bar food.
author: Katie P.

description: A nice space with two pool tables, two dart boards, HD flat screens everywhere you turn.  The crowd is a little older and male, but not offensively so.  Popcorn is a plus.  FYI, $15 minimum on the credit card tab.
author: Amy H.

description: Great place to watch a football or baseball (Red Sox) game. Lots of Sox fans there for Game 1, it was weird. Plenty of space but not much seating, free popcorn, lots of televisions. Marginal bar food, good if you need it. Great beer selection. Friendly bar and wait people although a bit understaffed when it's packed. Great sports bar. Go Pats!
author: trey b.

description: Great neighborhood bar where in the fall I can walk in, grab a beer and stumble into a Big Ten Football fan who knows a Hoosier from a Hawkeye.
author: Todd S.

description: I use to come to the Final Final when I worked at the PSE, after work at like 1pm during the week back in the 80's.  Those were some fantastic times!  Anyway, on Saturday night after we left the Outlands Festival, we decided to hang in the city a bit.  My friends had never been to the Final, and I wanted to go somewhere not to busy it was midnight and there were actually quite a few people from the festival there.  There were 6 of us and we order some pints of Guinness with a few mixed drinks, bartender made us very stiff drinks which was nice although I really do not think we needed them, good service nice enough crowd not to loud.  Some of the atmosphere seemed different, but it is still a fun bar that only regulars really know about, the prices are good and if you want to stay a bit out of the limelight, it is a good spot.
author: A M.

description: It's a dive bar without the je ne sais quoi of my other favorite dives like Marina Lounge and Trax.  But I do give a point to the bartender for letting me know when my tab went over $100.  It actually made me giggle...
author: M B.

description:
Okay people, when I walk up to an unapologetic dive sports bar that has self serve popcorn and has called itself
"Final Final"  this is what i expect:
1... A lot of televisions that have different games playing
2...Cold beer and shots
3... A bartender that's priority is knowledge of sports over fine wine knowledge.
And guess what, they pass all three criterion!!!  You want Fleur de Lys service??? Go to Fleur de Lys.  It's a dive sports bar, and they do a good job at being one.
author: Sam T.

description: definition of a great neighborhood bar.  tvs, pool, darts, popcorn, lots of beers on tap, pitchers, cool bartender, awesome memorabilia of the niners and giants!
author: shaun l.

description: great name.   this place is the anti-fillmore.  but, there also isn't much to it.  there are 2 pool tables and a dart board, but i'd rather go to the pig and whistle or the bitter end for a "little" personality.   [as an aside, i've been dragged here a few times a week for the past few months by friends -- i'm kinda over it].
author: Tim G.

description: i not an upper scale bar but you will fin cheap Beer, best free pop-corn in town, cool people at lots of fun.
author: Matt W.

description: stay away from the final final if you don't like popcorn in your hair.  or your beer.  because, then, you must suck.  and we wouldn't want you here anyway.  grab a cool adult beverage and pick up a game of pool.
author: shana m.

description: So I know this place is a shithole, and that I knew that going in. If you are going to be a shithole, own it, with the dingy floors, gross Swine flu carrying popcorn machine, etc., don't try to price out your beers as though you are the hot nightclub. All I wanted was one Guinness on a Wednesday night to catch the end of the Giants game. The lame excuse for a bartender starts to pour the Guinness, comes back and asks me for $5.75. Not a problem, but he sits there and waits for me to pay him.......before he even serves me, (WTF) so I give him $7. He then brings back a Guinness in some shitty 14oz excuse for a pint glass, instead of the customary 20 oz. Imperial pint that it is supposed to be served in. After taking a few sips, I ask him if this is customary for a $5.75 Guinness and his answer is yes and walks away without an explanation or even smart ass comeback that I could appreciate from a shithole dive bartender. If you are going to be a dive bar in the Marina, charge dive bar prices, but $5.57 for a 14 oz. Guinness, I could go to Johny Foley's in Union Square and pay that for a 20 oz. Guinness. This place has the worst bartenders.....50 year old bald guys should have some personality at a dive..... Either own your filth or clean up your shitty bar for those prices
author: Jim M.

description:
nice to go to a sports bar with tons of tv's and many places to sit. i am usually with all of the jocks that the ever-so-cranky people yelp about. why go to a marina bar if you dont like marina people? kindof like going to a chinese restaurant if you do not like chinese food, if you ask me. the parking is not horrific, the drinks are reasonable and there is a fantastic buger spot around the corner. you can watch more than one game here (march madness was perfect) and order wings to tie you over. i also like the bartender--nice elderly man who literally lives to please...checked on our loud and obnoxious basketball watching group religiously.....without ever getting irritated that we were ordering at different times and slurring our words. 
I had a great time here. perfect place to blow off steam and watch games. it is not near too many other bars...not a terrific spot for "bar hopping". i am always up for a neighborhood spot that is unpretentious with tons of seats, Final Final is exactly that.
author: Katie F.
